lines.text: The best weapon a woman has is a man's imagination.
[Tarzan awakens Jane by blowing lightly in her face]
Tarzan, you're a bad boy.
Good morning, I love you.
Good morning, I love you. You never forget, do you, Tarzan?
Never forget... I love you.
Love who?
Love you.

[shakes her head]
M-mm! Love who?
Love Jane.
Love... my...
My... wife. My wife!
Oh, Tarzan!
[She giggles as he nibbles her neck]
Go on now, lazy bones. Go and get my fruit juice. Go on.
[Tarzan reaches over and hands her her cup]
Ooo, you've been out shopping early, huh? Or did you spend the night at the club? Now, you can't get around me like that. Are you sure there isn't another woman?

[points at Jane]
Woman.
[points to himself]
Man.
That's the way it should be, Tarzan.
[They kiss]
I love you. Happy.
[first lines]
I wouldn't trust meself in that jungle if it was me, sir.
Well, I will.
But he's got to understand. Every penny we've got in the world is tied up in this.
Tarzan knows nothing about money. That wouldn't mean anything to him.
Well, what's the harm? They're all dead.
[referring to the elephants in the Elephants Graveyard]
It's as though somebody asked you to rob a graveyard back home.
But these are animals. They're not humans. This is different.
Not to him.
I belong with him.
Dead men can't give orders.
Yes they can.
[last lines]

[points to wrist]
Always gone.
No dear, always is just beginning, for you and me.
Did you bring the dresses and the things that I wrote for?
Everything and a few extras.
I suppose you thought I was crazy.
Uh-huh. So, your lady turned you down for a sort of a wild man from Borneo, eh? Its a bit fantastic. isn't it. A well bred English girl living in the treetops with a glorified native ape man.
Tarzan's as white as we are.

Throw that down to me, Cheeta. Cheeta. Give that to me! Oh, Cheeta, that isn't funny. Throw it down to me Cheeta. Throw it down! Cheeta, can't you see I've got nothing on. Cheeta, give it. Give it to me. Give it to me! Give it... that's a good monkey.
You want me to go back, don't you?
You must go back, Jane.
Why?
You can't stay here. Supposing anything happened to him. You couldn't live.
I don't think I'd want to.
That's nonsense. Suppose he were to die.
Why should he?
Anything can happen in this place, Jane. Where would you be then?
Where would he be if I went back?
Well... well, let him come along, too.
Tarzan over there? Then he would die.
You know, you're the first woman I ever had to coax into an evening gown.
I imagine that isn't your usual practice.
Well, everything seems to go by opposites here. I believe I have this dance, Lady Jane.
Oh yes!
[They begin to dance]
You know, I really promised this dance to the duke of Riverbottom, but as the old fogey isn't here, we'll let him wait.
Thank you. You know, you're a fascinating little savage.
Hmm?
[Martin forcibly kisses Jane. She pulls away, horrified]
Forgive me, please. I forgot myself. You're... you're so lovely.
I blame myself as much as you.
Please don't.
Oh, we'll forget about it, if you'll remember that there's only one man that means anything to me. And that's Tarzan.

[watches Tarzan and Jane swing on vines]
Going through the jungle is play for them.
That is playing, eh?
Mm-hmm.
Well, I wonder what they do for exercise.
[They both laugh]

[ties a pocket watch around Tarzan's wrist]
This was my father's. I want you to wear it... always.
Always.

[Awakens Jane by blowing lightly in her face]
'Morning. I love you.
Good morning. I love you.

[Holds up wrist with the pocket watch]
Always.
Yes, darling. Always.
He... he can't be... gone.
Jane, you must face facts. They're cruel, but you must.
Why, he's fought a hundred crocodiles!
He didn't see it. I shouted. He turned, but there was nothing he could do.
He might have got away.
Jane, you've got to look after yourself.

[runs to Harry]
Did you find any... any... any...
Sorry.
But there must be some traces. Even if he were... were...
[crying]
[a native man finds the pocket watch in the river]

[grimly takes the watch]
He said... always!
[crying]
[Martin starts to lead Jane away]
Wait.
[She turns and drops the pocket watch into the river]
Take me away.
